name: aerobic

aerobic adjective
(NEEDING OXYGEN)
Add to word list
Add to word list
biology
  specialized involving, needing, or relating to oxygen: Enterococci are aerobic bacteria found in the faeces of warm-blooded birds and mammals. ATP is produced in the cell by both aerobic respiration and anaerobic respiration. The great majority of all living organisms are aerobic, requiring oxygen for respiration. Compare
anaerobic
More examplesFewer examplesAerobic organisms need oxygen to create energy via respiration.These bacteria are termed aerobic, meaning they require oxygen to function.

aerobic adjective
(EXERCISE)
(of exercise) improving the body's ability to use oxygen: aerobic exercise Regular aerobic exercise not only helps to burn fat, it helps to prevent heart disease. Try to do 30 minutes of aerobic activities like cycling, running, swimming, or walking at least three times a week. See
aerobics
